body:
The following code crashes Cython 0.25.2. It compiles fine on 0.25.1. This is the whole file.

```
    def fn():
        value = {}
        for k, v in value.items():
            value=k
```

The following variant also causes a crash (again in 0.25.2 but not 0.25.1):

```
    def fn():
        value = {}
        for k, value in value.items():
            pass
```

The thing to notice about both these snippets is the variable `value`, which is used to define the iterator of the `for` loop, is assigned to in the loop. In the first example it is assigned to in the loop body, and in the second example it is assigned to in the `for` loop target list. Admittedly, both are bad code style.

If `value.items()` is changed to `value`, or if the iteration is put in global scope rather than in a function, then the crash doesn't happen. The `-2` and `-3` switches make no difference.

Here is the full console output:

```
Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
def fn():
    value = {}
    for k, value in value.items():
                              ^
------------------------------------------------------------

loop.py:7:31: Compiler crash in AnalyseExpressionsTransform

ModuleNode.body = StatListNode(loop.py:5:0)
StatListNode.stats[0] = DefNode(loop.py:5:0,
    is_cyfunction = True,
    modifiers = [...]/0,
    name = 'fn',
    py_wrapper_required = True,
    reqd_kw_flags_cname = '0',
    used = True)
File 'Nodes.py', line 430, in analyse_expressions: StatListNode(loop.py:6:4)
File 'Nodes.py', line 6178, in analyse_expressions: ForInStatNode(loop.py:7:4)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 519, in analyse_expressions: NextNode(loop.py:7:20,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 2733, in analyse_types: NextNode(loop.py:7:20,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 2730, in infer_type: NextNode(loop.py:7:20,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 3310, in infer_type: IndexNode(loop.py:7:20,
    is_subscript = True,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 4959, in infer_type: SimpleCallNode(loop.py:7:31,
    analysed = True,
    is_temp = 1,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "/home/arthur/envs/default/lib/python3.5/site-packages/Cython/Compiler/ExprNodes.py", line 4959, in infer_type
    arg_types = [arg.infer_type(env) for arg in self.args]
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
```
title: Compiler crash in AnalyseExpressionsTransform: TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
